summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing dated September 21, 2020, covering a wide range of national security, criminal, and political news. It includes a section on international relations noting increased pressure on Prince Andrew to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation after his private chef spoke to agents.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in the 'International Relations' section as facing increased pressure to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation after his private chef spoke to agents.

persons.name: Adam Perry Lang
persons.context: Reported to have worked for Jeffrey Epstein from 1999 to 2003 and offered to speak with FBI investigators about Prince Andrew's travels with Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the 'late pedophile pal' of Prince Andrew, whose chef is now speaking to the FBI.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as a British socialite accused by Virginia Guiffre of arranging for her to have sex with Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Virginia Guiffre
persons.context: Mentioned as having accused Ghislaine Maxwell of arranging for her to have sex with Prince Andrew when she was 17.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Frequently mentioned in the 'Leading the News' section regarding his congressional testimony on Antifa and Russian election interference, with President Trump expressing displeasure.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned throughout the briefing in various contexts, including criticizing FBI Director Wray, discussing Supreme Court nominations, and commenting on mail-in ballots.

persons.name: Sidney Powell
persons.context: Reportedly on a White House shortlist to replace FBI Director Christopher Wray; she was the lawyer for Michael Flynn.

persons.name: Michael Flynn
persons.context: Mentioned as the client of attorney Sidney Powell, who is reportedly on a shortlist to replace FBI Director Wray.

persons.name: Jim Comey
persons.context: Mentioned by Rep. Jim Jordan as being 'at the center' of the Russiagate controversy and scheduled to testify before the Senate Judiciary Committee.

persons.name: Jim Jordan
persons.context: Commented that former FBI Director Jim Comey's testimony is key to answering questions about the Russia probe.

persons.name: Marco Rubio
persons.context: Stated that the FBI was warned by the intelligence community not to rely on the Steele dossier.

persons.name: John Robertson
persons.context: Identified in a book excerpt as the FBI agent investigating Anthony Weiner who found Hillary Clinton's emails, helping spark an October 2016 investigation.

persons.name: Anthony Weiner
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of an FBI sex crimes investigation; emails from his laptop belonging to Huma Abedin (and Hillary Clinton) were found.

persons.name: Huma Abedin
persons.context: Her emails were found on Anthony Weiner's laptop during an FBI investigation.

persons.name: Hillary Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the FBI investigation sparked by emails found on Anthony Weiner's laptop.

persons.name: Jerry Harris
persons.context: Arrested on federal child pornography charges; featured in the Netflix documentary 'Cheer'.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Reported as not ruling out impeaching President Trump to stop a Supreme Court nominee from being confirmed.

persons.name: Amy Coney Barrett
persons.context: Reported as a top contender on President Trump's list to replace Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

persons.name: Barbara Lagoa
persons.context: Reported as another top contender on President Trump's list for the Supreme Court vacancy.

connections.description: Described as friends; Epstein is referred to as Prince Andrew's 'late pedophile pal' with whom he traveled on a private jet.
Lang was Prince Andrew's private chef during the period he traveled with Jeffrey Epstein.
Lang worked for Jeffrey Epstein from 1999 to 2003.
Guiffre has accused Maxwell of arranging for her to have sex with Prince Andrew when she was a minor.
Guiffre has accused Prince Andrew of having sex with her when she was 17, arranged by Ghislaine Maxwell.
President Trump expressed displeasure with FBI Director Wray's congressional testimony and hinted he might replace him.
Powell is identified as the lawyer for former National Security Adviser Michael Flynn.
FBI agent Robertson was investigating Anthony Weiner for sex crimes when he found emails linked to Hillary Clinton.
Weiner was married to Huma Abedin at the time of the FBI investigation.

events.title: FBI News Briefing Published
events.description: Bulletin Intelligence publishes its daily FBI Public Affairs News Briefing covering leading news, protests, counter-terrorism, criminal investigations, and other topics.

events.title: Scheduled Comey Testimony
events.description: Former FBI Director Jim Comey is scheduled to appear before the Senate Judiciary Committee.

events.title: Cheerleader Arrested on Child Porn Charges
events.description: Jerry Harris, a cheerleader featured in a Netflix documentary, was arrested and charged with production of child pornography.

events.title: Ricin Letter Intercepted
events.description: An envelope containing the poison ricin, addressed to President Trump, was intercepted at a government mail facility. A suspect was later arrested.

events.title: Pressure on Prince Andrew Increases
events.description: News reports indicate Prince Andrew faces increased pressure to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation after his private chef, Adam Perry Lang, spoke to agents.

keyFacts: Prince Andrew is facing increased pressure to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation after his private chef, Adam Perry Lang, offered to speak with agents.
FBI Director Christopher Wray's congressional testimony on Antifa and Russian election interference drew criticism from President Trump, who hinted Wray might be replaced.
Attorney Sidney Powell, who represented Michael Flynn, was reportedly on a White House shortlist to replace FBI Director Wray.
A ricin-laced letter addressed to President Trump was intercepted at a government mail facility, leading to an arrest.
The news briefing references the 'FinCEN Files' leak, revealing how global banks moved trillions in suspicious transactions, facilitating terrorism and crime.
